item.title: Oil Set for Weekly Gains on Inflation Hopes, Supply Issues
item.description: Oil prices declined in Europe, but were set for their third weekly gain, as positive economic signals in the U.S. and supply challenges lifted prices.

item.title: He Makes $1 Million a Golf Tournament. He Can Thank the Golf War.
item.description: Scottie Scheffler has won handsomely from the PGA Tour’s battle with Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Gold Likely to Find Support in the Medium Term
item.description: Gold prices are likely to find support in the medium term, with a peaking of interest rates and a softening of the dollar to act as a tailwind for the yellow metal, according to ANZ.

item.title: Burberry Backs Full-Year Views
item.description: Burberry reiterated its full-year and mid-term guidance after posting an 18% rise in first-quarter sales, in line with expectations.

item.title: Swedish Krona Resurfaces After Recent Sharp Losses
item.description: The Swedish krona’s strong appreciation in recent days is the clearest attempt at a turnaround since March this year, SEB said.

item.title: Nikkei Slips 0.1%, Dragged by Auto, Retail Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended slightly lower, dragged by falls in auto and retail stocks, amid lessened prospects for further Fed tightening and USD/JPY declines.

item.title: Ten-Year German Bund Yields Seen Struggling Above 2.50%
item.description: If a significant challenge to the ECB terminal deposit rate pricing of 4% is absent, it will be difficult for 10-year Bund yields to remain above 2.5%, Barclays said.

item.title: Nokia Cuts Sales Outlook, Narrows Margin Guidance
item.description: Nokia now sees full-year sales of between €23.2-€24.6 billion and lowered its operating margin outlook on weaker demand in its network infrastructure and mobile networks businesses.

item.title: Ericsson Posts Smaller-Than-Expected Loss
item.description: Ericsson reported a second-quarter loss of SEK686 million, as sales rose 3%, with earnings weighed down by restructuring charges, and said trends and market mix will likely be similar in the third quarter.

item.title: Cathay Pacific Guides for First-Half Profit Amid Reopening
item.description: Cathay Pacific Airways expects to swing to a profit in the first half of the year, as a rebound in travel demand after China’s reopening helped the carrier recover from tough pandemic years.

item.title: House GOP Threatens to Derail Defense Bill Over Abortion, Transgender Care
item.description: Democrats have warned that divisive social-issue amendments would be poison pills.

item.title: Hong Kong Takes Its Crackdown Abroad
item.description: Authorities are questioning families and placing hefty bounties on overseas activists sought under violations of the national security law.

item.title: Drones Reach Stratospheric Heights in Race to Fly Higher, Longer
item.description: New military and commercial craft aim to go far higher than jumbo jets and stay there for months, offering a more flexible alternative to satellites.

item.title: If You Find the Economy Confusing, Don't Worry: It Is
item.description: Puzzled investors should diversify and hope to do just OK in any scenario.

item.title: Fed to Debate What Would Prompt Rate Hike This Fall
item.description: The central bank is preparing to raise interest rates this month to a 22-year high.

item.title: Hours after Wagner's Prigozhin began a short-lived march on Moscow, Russia's domestic security service detained several high-ranking military officers, including Gen. Sergei Surovikin, head of aerospace forces, people familiar with the situation said.
item.description: Hours after Wagner’s Prigozhin began a short-lived march on Moscow, Russia’s domestic security service detained several high-ranking military officers, including Gen. Sergei Surovikin, head of aerospace forces, people familiar with the situation said.

item.title: Celsius Network founder Mashinsky was arrested in New York and charged by the Justice Department with defrauding the collapsed crypto exchange's customers.
item.description: Celsius Network founder Mashinsky was arrested in New York and charged by the Justice Department with defrauding the collapsed crypto exchange’s customers.

item.title: The FTC is investigating whether OpenAI's ChatGPT has harmed people by publishing false information about them, posing a potential legal threat to the popular app that can generate eerily human-like content using artificial intelligence.
item.description: The FTC is investigating whether OpenAI’s ChatGPT has harmed people by publishing false information about them, posing a potential legal threat to the popular app that can generate eerily human-like content using artificial intelligence.

item.title: Booming summer travel and falling fuel prices helped drive record revenue and profit in the second quarter for Delta Air Lines.
item.description: Booming summer travel and falling fuel prices helped drive record revenue and profit in the second quarter for Delta Air Lines.

item.title: A group of Republican attorneys general issued a letter to the nation's largest companies warning them against race-based preferences in hiring, promotions and contracting following a recent Supreme Court decision.
item.description: A group of Republican attorneys general issued a letter to the nation’s largest companies warning them against race-based preferences in hiring, promotions and contracting following a recent Supreme Court decision.
